layman:
AB CD, M.D.  
XYZ Street, City, State  

Dear Dr. CD,

Thank you for seeing Mr. XYZ, a pleasant 19‑year‑old man who first came to you in 2005 for suspected seizures. He is still taking Dilantin 300 mg daily and has had no seizure episodes for the past 2½ years. He would like to stop the medication. When I reviewed your 2005 note, there was some confusion about what happened during his emergency‑room visits, and we had discussed possibly stopping the drug. His current physical and neurological exam is normal. His Dilantin level is a little low at 12.5. Please evaluate him and let me know whether we should keep him on Dilantin. I expect you may need to repeat his EEG, so please arrange that through the Health Center. I look forward to your recommendation. If any labs are needed, we use ABC Diagnostic, and any additional tests should be coordinated with the Health Center before scheduling.
